attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: A comma separated list with full qualified class names. Class names should match passed parameters in the same order as they were defined.
attribute.name: parameters

tag.description: Advanced Tooltip component.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Value of the component than can be either an EL expression of a literal text.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: An EL expression or a literal text that defines a converter for the component.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: A global tooltip converts each title attribute to a tooltip. Default value is false.
attribute.name: global

attribute.description: A shared tooltip - one tooltip, multiple targets. Default value is false.
attribute.name: shared

attribute.description: This flag enables showing tooltips automatically after page loading. Auto shown tooltips can not be global or shared. Default value is false.
attribute.name: autoShow

attribute.description: This flag enables tooltip's positioning in relation to the mouse. Default value is false.
attribute.name: mouseTracking

attribute.description: When set to true, the tooltip will not hide if moused over, allowing the contents to be clicked and interacted with. Default value is false.
attribute.name: fixed

attribute.description: Style class of the tooltip will override ThemeRoller theme. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: Header or Titlebar of the tooltip. Not applicable on global tooltips. Default value is null.
attribute.name: header

attribute.description: A positive or negative pixel value by which to offset the tooltip in the horizontal plane (x-axis). Negative values cause a reduction in the value (moves tooltip to the left). Default value is 0.
attribute.name: adjustX

attribute.description: A positive or negative pixel value by which to offset the tooltip in the vertical plane (y-axis). Negative values cause a reduction in the value (moves tooltip upwards). Default value is 0.
attribute.name: adjustY

attribute.description: The corner of the target element to position the tooltips corner at. Default value is 'bottom right'.
attribute.name: atPosition

attribute.description: The corner of the tooltip to position in relation to the target element. Default value is 'top left'.
attribute.name: myPosition

attribute.description: Event displaying the tooltip. Default value is mouseenter.
attribute.name: showEvent

attribute.description: Delay time for displaying the tooltip. Default value is 0.
attribute.name: showDelay

attribute.description: Effect to be used for displaying. Default value is fadeIn.
attribute.name: showEffect

attribute.description: Time in milliseconds to display the effect. Default value is 500.
attribute.name: showEffectLength

attribute.description: Event hiding the tooltip. Default value is mouseleave.
attribute.name: hideEvent

attribute.description: Delay time for hiding the tooltip. Default value is 0.
attribute.name: hideDelay

attribute.description: Effect to be used for hiding. Default value is fadeOut.
attribute.name: hideEffect

attribute.description: Time in milliseconds to process the hide effect. Default value is 500.
attribute.name: hideEffectLength

attribute.description: Id of the component to attach the tooltip.
attribute.name: for

tag.description: Page Layout component. Client behavior events: open - fires after a layout pane gets opened (org.primefaces.extensions.event.OpenEvent), close - fires after a layout pane gets closed (org.primefaces.extensions.event.CloseEvent), resize - fires after a layout pane gets resized (org.primefaces.extensions.event.ResizeEvent).

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: Specifies whether layout should span all page or not. Default value is true.
attribute.name: fullPage

attribute.description: Layout options as an instance of the class LayoutOptions or an JSON String representing serialized LayoutOptions. LayoutOptions created as Java model takes precedence over layout options as tag attributes. Serializing of layout options to an JSON string can increase the time of layout building when the layout is built during application startup in an application scoped bean (LayoutOptions gets always serialized to JSON to be able to be used in the underlying widget). Use the method toJson() in the LayoutOptions if you want to serialize all options to an JSON string.
attribute.name: options

attribute.description: Style of the main Layout container element. Default value is null.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: Style class of the main Layout container element. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: Indicates server-side state management. A hash (JSON string) containing all dimensions and close, open state of existing layout panes. It can be bound to a bean.
attribute.name: state

attribute.description: Indicates client-side state management. When set to true the current layout state will be stored in cookies on window unload and restored during layout build-up when user enters the same page. Default is false.
attribute.name: stateCookie

attribute.description: Tip when resizer-bar can be dragged to resize a pane. Default is 'Resize'.
attribute.name: resizerTip

attribute.description: Tip when the resizer-bar will trigger 'sliding open'. Default is 'Slide Open'.
attribute.name: sliderTip

attribute.description: Tip on toggler when pane is 'open'. Default is 'Close'.
attribute.name: togglerTipOpen

attribute.description: Tip on toggler when pane is 'closed'. Default is 'Open'.
attribute.name: togglerTipClosed

attribute.description: Useful flag if you are dealing with iframes or objects like applets inside layout panes. This option triggers masking each time the mouse moves over a resizer - instead of waiting until your 'grab it' with your mouse. This is done just in case you are about to grab & drag the resizer. Enabling this avoids the slight delay that sometimes occurs when you quickly grab a resizer and try to drag over an iframe or object. Default is false.
attribute.name: maskPanesEarly

tag.description: Layout pane within Layout component. 5 regions are supported: 'north', 'south', 'center', 'west' und 'east'.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Position of a pane. Possible values are 'north', 'south', 'west', 'east', 'center'. Default value is 'center'.
attribute.name: position

attribute.description: Style of the pane's header. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleHeader

attribute.description: Style class of the pane's header. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleClassHeader

attribute.description: Style of the pane's content. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleContent

attribute.description: Style class of the pane's content. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleClassContent

attribute.description: Makes a pane resizable. Default is true.
attribute.name: resizable

attribute.description: Makes a pane closable. Default is true.
attribute.name: closable

attribute.description: When closed, can a pane 'slide open' over adjacent panes. Default is true.
attribute.name: slidable

attribute.description: Specifies the initial size of a pane in px or %. Default value is null.
attribute.name: size

attribute.description: Specifies the minimum-size limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null.
attribute.name: minSize

attribute.description: Specifies the maximum-size limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null.
attribute.name: maxSize

attribute.description: Specifies the minimum-width limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null - as small as pane can go.
attribute.name: minWidth

attribute.description: Specifies the maximum-width limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null - as large as pane can go.
attribute.name: maxWidth

attribute.description: Specifies the minimum-height limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null - as small as pane can go.
attribute.name: minHeight

attribute.description: Specifies the maximum-height limit in px or % when resizing a pane. Default value is null - as large as pane can go.
attribute.name: maxHeight

attribute.description: Spacing in px between pane and adjacent pane - when pane is 'open'. Default value is 6.
attribute.name: spacingOpen

attribute.description: Spacing in px between pane and adjacent pane - when pane is 'closed'. Default value is 6.
attribute.name: spacingClosed

attribute.description: Tip when resizer-bar can be dragged to resize a pane. Default is 'Resize'.
attribute.name: resizerTip

attribute.description: Tip when the resizer-bar will trigger 'sliding open'. Default is 'Slide Open'.
attribute.name: sliderTip

attribute.description: Tip on toggler when pane is 'open'. Default is 'Close'.
attribute.name: togglerTipOpen

attribute.description: Tip on toggler when pane is 'closed'. Default is 'Open'.
attribute.name: togglerTipClosed

attribute.description: If true, then pane is 'closed' when layout is created. Default is false.
attribute.name: initClosed

attribute.description: If true, then pane is hidden when layout is created - no resizer or spacing is visible, as if the pane does not exist. Default is false.
attribute.name: initHidden

attribute.description: If true, then pane gets resized live while it is dragging. If false, only helper element shows resizing. Default is false.
attribute.name: resizeWhileDragging

attribute.description: Useful flag if you are dealing with iframes inside layout panes. If true, this option adds a DIV-mask over-or-inside this pane, so user can drag (resize) the pane over iframe. Default is false.
attribute.name: maskContents

attribute.description: Useful flag if you are dealing with objects like applets inside layout panes. If true, this option add IFRAME-mask over-or-inside this pane to cover objects / applets - content-mask will overlay this mask. Default is false.
attribute.name: maskObjects

tag.description: MasterDetail component allows to group contents into levels (sections) and saves page space. Smart and flexible navigation between levels via breadcrumbs or command components gives a neat and stylish interface for users.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a naming container.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Current level in flow. It can be arbitrary initialized and gets updated with each navigation. It allows to show any initial level when a view with MasterDetail component(s) is displayed. Default is 1.
attribute.name: level

attribute.description: Context value for the current level. It can be arbitrary initialized at beginning and gets updated with each navigation. Default is null.
attribute.name: contextValue

attribute.description: Method with signature int methodName(SelectLevelEvent). Server-side listener invoking when a navigation attempt takes place (via pe:selectDetailLevel). Return value defines the level to go. Default is null.
attribute.name: selectLevelListener

attribute.description: Flag whether a breadcrumb navigation is shown or not. Default is true.
attribute.name: showBreadcrumb

attribute.description: Per default breadcrumb items right from the current level are not shown. This flag allows to show all breadcrumb items right from the current level as disabled. Default is false.
attribute.name: showAllBreadcrumbItems

attribute.description: Boolean flag to allow rendering of breadcrumb above or below header facet. Default is true.
attribute.name: breadcrumbAboveHeader

attribute.description: Style of the main MasterDetail container element. Default is null.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: Style class of the main MasterDetail container element. Default is null.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a naming container.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Level of this detail. Level is unique inside of masterDetail component. This is a required attribute. Default is none.
attribute.name: level

attribute.description: Variable to access the value set by pe:selectDetailLevel when the level is changed. If the value was not set by currently invoking pe:selectDetailLevel, the last set value is be used. Default is null.
attribute.name: contextVar

attribute.description: Label for the corresponding breadcrumb item shown on top. Default is none.
attribute.name: levelLabel

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether the breadcrumb item is disabled (not clickable). Default is dalse.
attribute.name: levelDisabled

attribute.description: Context value passing to the level to be navigated. Value defined here is accessible by contextVar in MasterDetailLevel. Default is none.
attribute.name: contextValue

attribute.description: Listener method which is fired before action / actionListener of component, pe:selectDetailLevel is attached to, gets called. Return value of this listener is used as a new / modified contextValue. The listener allows to pass a new / modified contextValue between levels. Default is none.
attribute.name: listener

attribute.description: Level to go to. Default is none.
attribute.name: level

attribute.description: Specifies how many steps to go. Can be negative. If level and step are not specified, then step = 1 is assumed. Default is none.
attribute.name: step

attribute.description: Specifies comma or blank separated list of clientIds of editable components whose inputs have to be preserved while levels get switched. @all is allowed and means all values within master detail have to be preserved. It makes sense e.g. if corresponding command component has "immediate"=true attribute. If nothing specified, input values gets cleared.
attribute.name: preserveInputs

attribute.description: Specifies comma or blank separated list of clientIds of editable components whose inputs have to be cleared while levels get switched. @all is allowed and means all values within master detail have to be cleared. It takes precedence over clientIds in preserveInputs.
attribute.name: resetInputs

attribute.description: Name(s) of one or several accepted events of f:ajax / p:ajax in case when SelectDetailLevel is attached to any component with ajax behavior. Several events should be defined as space or comma separated list. If no events are specified, all events will be accepted.
attribute.name: event

tag.description: blockUI blocks any piece of page during various Ajax calls.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: Styles for the message when blocking. Styles should be defined as JSON object, e.g. {backgroundColor: 'fff', width: 30%}.
attribute.name: css

attribute.description: Styles for the overlay. Styles should be defined as JSON object, e.g. {opacity: 0.4, backgroundColor: 'red'}
attribute.name: cssOverlay

attribute.description: Specifies component(s) which send(s) an ajax request and triggers blocking. If nothing specified, the parent component is used.
attribute.name: source

attribute.description: Specifies component(s) or HTML element(s) to be blocked. If the target is null or not defined, the entire page is blocked.
attribute.name: target

attribute.description: Id of the component in terms of findComponent to be used as content shown during blocking. If nothing specified, the content of blockUI component is used.
attribute.name: content

attribute.description: Name(s) of one or several accepted events. Several events should be defined as space or comma separated list.
attribute.name: event

attribute.description: Flag whether the blocking is shown automatically without the need to use JavaScript widget. Default value is false.
attribute.name: autoShow

attribute.description: Time in millis to wait before auto-unblocking. Don't define it or set to 0 to disable auto-unblock. Default value is 0.
attribute.name: timeout

attribute.description: Set this attribute to true to have the message automatically centered along the X axis. Note: it only effects element blocking (page blocking controlled by CSS via the css attribute). Default value is true.
attribute.name: centerX

attribute.description: Set this attribute to true to have the message automatically centered along the Y axis. Default value is true.
attribute.name: centerY

attribute.description: Fade In time in millis; set to 0 to disable fadeIn on block.
attribute.name: fadeIn

attribute.description: Fade Out time in millis; set to 0 to disable fadeOut on unblock.
attribute.name: fadeOut

attribute.description: Disable if you do not want to show the overlay. Default value is true.
attribute.name: showOverlay

attribute.description: Focus will be placed in the first available input field when page blocking. Default value is true.
attribute.name: focusInput

tag.description: Time picker component for time (hours / minutes) inputs. Client behavior events: timeSelect - fires when an hour / minutes is selected (org.primefaces.extensions.event.TimeSelectEvent), close - fires when the time picker is closed (org.primefaces.extensions.event.CloseEvent), beforeShow - fires before the time picker is rendered and displayed (org.primefaces.extensions.event.BeforeShowEvent).

attribute.description: Specifies number of rows for the input tables, minimum 2, makes more sense if you use multiple of 2. Default is 4.
attribute.name: rows

attribute.description: Defines if the hours section is displayed or not. Set to false to get a minute only dialog. Default is true.
attribute.name: showHours

attribute.description: Defines if the minutes section is displayed or not. Set to false to get a hours only dialog. Default is true.
attribute.name: showMinutes

attribute.description: Shows an 'ok' button to confirm the edit. Default is false.
attribute.name: showCloseButton

attribute.description: Shows the 'deselect' time button. Default is false.
attribute.name: showDeselectButton

attribute.description: Shows the 'now' button. Default is false.
attribute.name: showNowButton

attribute.description: Defines a callback to enable / disable certain hours. Example: function onHourShow(hour). Default is null.
attribute.name: onHourShow

attribute.description: Defines a callback to enable / disable certain minutes. Example: function onMinuteShow(hour, minute). Default is null.
attribute.name: onMinuteShow

attribute.description: Define when the timepicker is shown. 'focus': when the input gets focus, 'button' when the button trigger element is clicked, 'both': when the input gets focus and when the button is clicked. Default is 'focus'.
attribute.name: showOn

attribute.description: String or java.util.Locale representing user locale. Default is a locale specified in view root.

attribute.description: Set the minimum hour selectable by the user, disable hours previous to min. hours. Default is null (not set).

attribute.description: Set the minimum minutes selectable by the user, disable minutes previous to min. minutes. Default is null (not set).

tag.description: Waypoint makes it easy to execute a custom logic whenever you scroll to an element. Client behavior events: reached - fired when the user scrolls past the element. (org.primefaces.extensions.event.WaypointEvent)

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: The target component registered as waypoint. If null, the parent component will be taken as target. Default is null.
attribute.name: for

attribute.description: The context defines which scrollable element the waypoint belongs to and acts within. It can be a component or plain HTML element like a div. Default is window if nothing specified.
attribute.name: forContext

attribute.description: If false, this waypoint will be created but will be disabled from triggering. You can call widget's method "enable" to turn it back on. Default is true.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.description: Default waypoints live on the vertical axis. Their offset is calculated in relation to the top of the viewport and they listen for vertical scroll changes. If horizontal is set to true, offset is calculated in relation to the left of the viewport and listens for horizontal scroll changes. For instance, the value 50 means "when the left side of this element reaches 50px from the left side of the viewport". Default is false.
attribute.name: horizontal

attribute.description: This option determines how far the top of the element must be from the top of the viewport to trigger a waypoint (callback function). It can be a number, which is taken as a number of pixels (can be also negativ, e.g. -10), a string representing a percentage of the viewport height (e.g. '50%') or a function that will return a number of pixels. Default is 0.
attribute.name: offset

attribute.description: If true, and multiple waypoints are triggered in one scroll, this waypoint will trigger even if it is not the last waypoint reached. If false, it will only trigger if it is the last waypoint. Default is true.
attribute.name: continuous

attribute.description: If true, the waypoint will be destroyed when triggered. Default is false.
attribute.name: triggerOnce

tag.description: GChart is a JSF wrapper of Google Charts API. Client behavior events: select - fired when a "row" is selected (org.primefaces.event.SelectEvent)

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.

attribute.description: An el expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: width of the chart
attribute.name: width

attribute.description: height of the chart
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: Title of the chart
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: Value of the component. Use the GChartModelBuilder to create a new GChartModel
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.

tag.description: Timer Component

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: set to true to hide the timer. The listener will be fired anyway
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: An el expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: Timeut in seconds to do the ajax ajax requests. Default is 10.
attribute.name: timeout

attribute.description: Component(s) to be updated with ajax.
attribute.name: update

attribute.description: A method expression to invoke by polling.
attribute.name: listener

attribute.description: Boolean value that determines the phaseId, when true actions are processed at apply_request_values, when false at invoke_application phase.
attribute.name: immediate

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute before ajax request is begins.
attribute.name: onstart

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute when ajax request is completed.
attribute.name: oncomplete

attribute.description: Component id(s) to process partially instead of whole view.
attribute.name: process

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute when ajax request fails.
attribute.name: onerror

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute when ajax request succeeds.
attribute.name: onsuccess

attribute.description: Global ajax requests are listened by ajaxStatus component, setting global to false will not trigger ajaxStatus. Default is true.
attribute.name: global

attribute.description: If less than delay milliseconds elapses between calls to request() only the most recent one is sent and all other requests are discarded. The default value of this option is 300. If the value of delay is the literal string 'none' without the quotes, no delay is used.
attribute.name: delay

attribute.description: The format to use when diplaying the value. Accepted values are: 'percentage' to diplay the remaining time as percentage. 'Human' to print a human readable interval. Any other value will be evaluated as a moment.js format
attribute.name: format

attribute.description: client-side function used to format the remaining duration
attribute.name: formatFunction

attribute.description: When set to true, ajax requests are not queued. Default is false.
attribute.name: async

attribute.description: In autoStart mode, the timer will start immediatly. Default is true.
attribute.name: autoStart

attribute.description: Use this attribute to set the timer direction. Default value is false (backward)
attribute.name: forward

attribute.description: set to true to false the timer periodic. Default is true
attribute.name: singleRun

attribute.description: When enabled, only values related to partially processed components would be serialized for ajax instead of whole form.
attribute.name: partialSubmit

attribute.description: If true, indicate that this particular Ajax transaction is a value reset transaction. This will cause resetValue() to be called on any EditableValueHolder instances encountered as a result of this ajax transaction. If not specified, or the value is false, no such indication is made.
attribute.name: resetValues

attribute.description: If true, components which autoUpdate="true" will not be updated for this request. If not specified, or the value is false, no such indication is made.
attribute.name: ignoreAutoUpdate

attribute.description: Javascript handler executed every second
attribute.name: ontimerstep

attribute.description: Javascript handler executed the timeout stops
attribute.name: ontimercomplete

tag.description: SlideOut adds a tab slideout from the screen edge. Client behavior events: open - fires when the slideout is opened (org.primefaces.extensions.event.OpenEvent), close - fires when the slideout is closed (org.primefaces.extensions.event.CloseEvent).

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An el expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: Action which will open the panel, 'hover' or 'click'.
attribute.name: showOn

attribute.description: Text value to display on the handle. Default value is null.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: Icon image to display on the handle. Default value is null.
attribute.name: icon

attribute.description: Location on screen either left, right, top or bottom. Default value is right.
attribute.name: location

attribute.description: Speed of the slide out animation. Default is 300.
attribute.name: animateSpeed

attribute.description: How many bounces when 'bounce' is called. Default is 4.
attribute.name: bounceTimes

attribute.description: How far bounce event will move everything. Default value is 50px.
attribute.name: bounceDistance

attribute.description: True to have the tab follow the scroll of the window.
attribute.name: sticky

attribute.description: Close the tab when the rest of screen is clicked. Default is true.
attribute.name: clickScreenToClose

attribute.description: Automatically open tab on DOM load. Default is false.
attribute.name: autoOpen

attribute.description: Panel distance from top or left (bottom or right if offsetReverse is true). Default value is 200px.
attribute.name: offset

attribute.description: Panel is aligned with right or bottom of window. Default is false.
attribute.name: offsetReverse

attribute.description: Handle distance from top or left. If null, detects panel border to align handle nicely. Default value is NULL.
attribute.name: handleOffset

attribute.description: Handle is aligned with right or bottom of window. Default is false.
attribute.name: handleOffsetReverse

attribute.description: Style class of the tab handle element. Default value is null.
attribute.name: handleStyleClass

attribute.description: Inline style applied to the tab handle element. Default value is null.
attribute.name: handleStyle

attribute.description: Style class of the slideout container element. Default value is null.
attribute.name: panelStyleClass

attribute.description: Inline style applied to the slideout container element. Default value is null.
attribute.name: panelStyle

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute when the slideout opens.
attribute.name: onopen

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute when the slideout closes.
attribute.name: onclose

tag.description: Social is a component to display your social media.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An el expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: A string name of the share. Social supports following build-in shares: "email" | "twitter" | "facebook" | "googleplus" | "linkedin" | "pinterest" | "stumbleupon" | "pocket" | "whatsapp" | "viber" | "messenger" | "vkontakte" | "telegram" | "line" | "rss"
attribute.name: shares

attribute.description: Theme for the CSS: "classic" | "flat" | "minima" | "plain". Default to "classic"
attribute.name: theme

attribute.description: A string specifying url to share. Value of window.location.href is used by default.
attribute.name: url

attribute.description: A string specifying text to share. The content of meta name="description" or title (if first is missing) is used by default.
attribute.name: text

attribute.description: "blank" - share in the new browser tab "popup" - share in the new browser popup window "self" - share in the same browser tab.
attribute.name: shareIn

attribute.description: A boolean specifying whether to show the text on the share button. Default is true.
attribute.name: showLabel

attribute.description: A boolean or "inside" specifying whether and how to show share count. Default is true.
attribute.name: showCount

attribute.description: TO e-mail address for the email share option.
attribute.name: emailTo

attribute.description: A Twitter username specifying the source of a Tweet.
attribute.name: twitterUsername

attribute.description: A comma-separated list of hashtags to be appended to Tweet text.
attribute.name: twitterHashtags

attribute.description: A a url of media to share on Pinterest.
attribute.name: pinterestMedia

attribute.description: Style of the main container element. Default value is null.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: Style class of the main container element. Default value is null.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute for each social media share that is clicked on.
attribute.name: onclick

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute for each social media share that the mouse hovers over.
attribute.name: onmouseenter

attribute.description: Javascript handler to execute for each social media share that the mouse leaves.
attribute.name: onmouseleave

tag.description: Data sheet providing Excel like editing, frozen columns and rows, copy/paste, sorting, etc.

attribute.description: An el expression or a literal text that defines a converter for the component. When it's an EL expression, it's resolved to a converter instance. In case it's a static text, it must refer to a converter id.

attribute.description: Password mask defaulted to asterisks *. Note that you can't change symbol used by the input field due to browsers limitations.

attribute.description: By default every password has length equal to the length of value that it corresponds with. Use this option to set fixed hash length.

attribute.description: Numbers can be formatted to look like currency, percentages, times, or even plain old numbers with decimal places, thousands, and abbreviations.

attribute.description: Message to display when validation fails.

If a function is used, be sure to execute the callback argument with either true (callback(true)) if the validation passed or with false (callback(false)), if the validation failed. Note, that this in the function points to the cellProperties object.

tag.description: OrgChart based on https://github.com/dabeng/OrgChart

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An el expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Value of the component.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: It sets one property of datasource as unique identifier of every orgchart node. Default is "id"
attribute.name: nodeId

attribute.description: It sets one property of datasource as text content of content section of orgchart node. Default is title
attribute.name: nodeContent

attribute.description: The available values are t2b(implies "top to bottom", it's default value), b2t(implies "bottom to top"), l2r(implies "left to right"), r2l(implies "right to left").
attribute.name: direction

attribute.description: Users could pan the orgchart by mouse drag&drop if they enable this option. Default is false
attribute.name: pan

attribute.description: It indicates the level that at the very beginning orgchart is expanded to. Default is 999
attribute.name: depth

attribute.description: It enable the export button for orgchart. Default is false
attribute.name: exportButton

attribute.description: It's filename when you export current orgchart as a picture. Default is "Orgchart"
attribute.name: exportFilename

attribute.description: Available values are png and pdf. Default is "png"
attribute.name: exportFileextension

attribute.description: Using font awesome icon to imply that the node has child nodes. Default is "fa-users"
attribute.name: parentNodeSymbol

attribute.description: Users can drag & drop the nodes of orgchart if they enable this option. **Note**: this feature doesn't work on IE due to its poor support for HTML5 drag & drop API. Default is false
attribute.name: draggable

attribute.description: when you wanna instantiate multiple orgcharts on one page, you should add diffent classname to them in order to distinguish them. Default is ""
attribute.name: chartClass

attribute.description: Users could zoomin/zoomout the orgchart by mouse wheel if they enable this option. Default is false
attribute.name: zoom

attribute.description: Once enable this option, users can show/hide left/right sibling nodes respectively by clicking left/right arrow. Default is false
attribute.name: toggleSiblingsResp

attribute.description: Users are allowed to set a zoom-in limit. Default is 7
attribute.name: zoominLimit

attribute.description: Users are allowed to set a zoom-out limit. Default is 0.5
attribute.name: zoomoutLimit

attribute.description: Users can make use of this option to align the nodes vertically from the specified depth.
attribute.name: verticalDepth

attribute.description: It sets one property of datasource as text content of title section of orgchart node. In fact, users can create a simple orghcart with only nodeTitle option. Default is "name"
attribute.name: nodeTitle
